modules.description: This module implements client-side network communication over stream sockets using the Eio concurrency library. It provides functions to create and manage client connections with customizable read buffer sizes and protocol handlers, supporting operations like connection upgrade and graceful shutdown. Typical use cases include building network clients for protocols such as HTTP or custom binary protocols over TCP.

Handles incoming network connections using a specified protocol, managing request processing and socket communication. Works with stream sockets and addresses, supporting both standard and upgradable connection handling. Useful for implementing custom network servers that require protocol-specific logic and efficient data exchange over TCP.

This module facilitates network communication by managing both client and server operations over stream sockets using the Eio concurrency library. It supports creating client connections with customizable buffer sizes and protocol handlers, as well as processing incoming connections with protocol-specific logic. Key data types include socket addresses and protocol handlers, with operations for connection setup, data exchange, and graceful shutdown. You can use it to implement TCP-based clients and servers for protocols like HTTP or custom binary formats.
